page.title: 06AGRICULTURE
page.content: In our survey 12 farms were visited and below is a resume of the data collected. Average size of farm = 122 acres, with 3 over 200 and 2 under 20 acres; most farms have cows or beef cattle and sheep, but 4 have only cattle and calves; the average number of milk cows per herd is 42,but 4 no longer milk; only 3 farms rear beef cattle, in 2 herds of 60 and one of 4; the average herd of sheep is 213, but 6 farms have no sheep and 1 has only 40; the average number of hens per farm is 16. All the farmers have tractors, with the average of 3 per farm,plus 4 trailers. The average number of total implements per farm is 11, although only 3 farms have a power loader, a JCB or a slurry tanker.
